channel.title: [PI] Player Timer persisting on logout?
channel.description:
Ok for my vote4Cash System, after say the user claims their reward have this setup.
[code] c.VoteTimer = System.currentTimeMillis() + 86400000;[/code]
What that does is it sets a timer before the user is able to use the command ::claim again, and it does work real well except for the fact the timer unfortunately still resets after they logout. I was thinking I could make it save a variable when they logout and have the timer continue on login, but that is not what I want. I want a 24 hour timer regardless if they are online or offline.
You may refer to my previous thread about what some of it looks like.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,544160.0.html

item.title: [PI] Player Timer persisting on logout?
item.dc:creator: @insaneli insaneli
item.description:
@insaneli wrote:

xI c E:

You’d be better off using a system like me where you save the date that the user claims their reward and then check the current date with the date that they voted.

Actually, woulden’t making a player token along the lines of “votetime” set to the long of the current system time, and when the player goes to claim again it checks if votetime + 86400000 then they can claim again (right here is where it’ll set the long Day-Waited to the current system time that they claimed again. And thus a much easier system.

If the above was not legible, it was because I was trying to get the idea down before I forgot it, but how it would work is. By default the player token Day-Waited would be 0 so I can properly check if they’ve voted before and properly allow you to claim the first time only. It then sets Day-Waited to the current system time. next time they claim, if it’s not 0 it checks if votetime + 86400000 then allowing the player to claim the reward and setting the current system time as the votetime token, and so on.

Please tell me if this idea sounds like it’d work, it sounds far more easier then the dates personally.
